TI_DOC.P: FR-Paris: Levering af metaldetektorer og sikkerhedsudstyr til statsfængslet i Bosnien-Hercegovina

CONTENTS.P: 1. The Ministry of Justice of Bosnia and Herzegovina has applied for and received the Loan Nº F/P 1688 from the Council of Europe Development Bank (CEB) as well as contributing grants from the European commission, The Kingdom of Sweden and national contribution toward the cost of construction of the country's first high security state prison, and intends to apply a portion of the proceeds of this loan to eligible payments under the supply and installation of metal detectors and security equipment for the State prison Bosnia and Herzegovina.

2. The project implementation unit on behalf of the Ministry of Justice Bosnia and Herzegovina now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified bidders for the „Supply and installation of metal detectors and security equipment for the State prison Bosnia and Herzegovina“, Reference Nº: 04-16-77/17
The delivery periods is 60 days from signing the contract.
Maximum available funding for the procurement and installation of metal detectors and security equipment for the State prison Bosnia and Herzegovina is 409 033,50 EUR + 17 % VAT.

3. Bidding will be conducted through the international competitive bidding (ICB), procedure specified in the Council of Europe Development Bank’s guidelines November 2011, and is open to all bidders from eligible countries, as defined in the bidding documents.
4. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information and inspect the bidding documents upon written request at the address given below.

5. A complete set of bidding documents in English language may be purchased by interested bidders upon submission of a written application to the address above and upon received confirmation of bank transfer of a non-refundable fee of 30 EUR or 58,67 BAM, paid by money transfer to the bank account of the Ministry of finance and treasury with central bank according to the instructions below:
City, Country: Frankfurt Am Main, Germany
Name: Centralna Banka Bosne I Hercegovine
City, Country: Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina
Name: Ministarstvo financija i trezora BiH
City, Country Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina
Payment in BAM in BiH will be made in favour of the Ministry of finance and treasury at Raiffeisen Bank BiH deposit account 1610000010751006 following instructions below:
Fields that refers to the payment of public revenue must be filled as follows:
Field 1: "The number of the taxpayer": should contain a unique identification number of the citizen if paid by natural person, or thirteen digit identification number of the legal person;
Field 4 "Municipality": should contain the code of the municipality of residence;
Field 5 "Tax period": should contain date of payment;

The bidding documents will be sent by airmail and surface/or currier mail or may be collected by an authorized representative of the bidder from the office stated below upon presentation to the Projects Implementation Unit of bidder’s authorization. Documents will be available from: 6.3.2018.

6. Bids must be delivered to the address* below before or at 13:00 local time on 12.4.2018. Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be opened in the presence of the bidders’ representatives who choose to attend in person at the address below at 14:00 local time on 12.4.2018. All bids must be accompanied by a Bank Bid Security in the amount of 3 500 EUR, or an equivalent amount in a local currency (BAM).
7. The addresses referred to above is:
Jedinica za implementaciju Projekta / Project Implementation Unit

2. The project implementation unit on behalf of the Ministry of Justice Bosnia and Herzegovina now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified bidders for the „Supply and installation of metal detectors and security equipment for the State prison Bosnia and Herzegovina“, Reference Nº: 04-16-77/17
The delivery periods is 60 days from signing the contract.
Maximum available funding for the procurement and installation of metal detectors and security equipment for the State prison Bosnia and Herzegovina is 409 033,50 EUR + 17 % VAT.

3. Bidding will be conducted through the international competitive bidding (ICB), procedure specified in the Council of Europe Development Bank’s guidelines November 2011, and is open to all bidders from eligible countries, as defined in the bidding documents.
4. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information and inspect the bidding documents upon written request at the address given below.

5. A complete set of bidding documents in English language may be purchased by interested bidders upon submission of a written application to the address above and upon received confirmation of bank transfer of a non-refundable fee of 30 EUR or 58,67 BAM, paid by money transfer to the bank account of the Ministry of finance and treasury with central bank according to the instructions below:
